50#define ADD_STRING(b, s) { \
51 if (strlen(s) >= isc_buffer_availablelength(b)) \
52 return (ISC_R_NOSPACE); \
53 else \
54 isc_buffer_putstr(b, s); \
55}

69static bool short_form = false, printcmd = true,
70 plusquest = false, pluscomm = false,
71 ipv4only = false, ipv6only = false, digrc = true;
72static uint32_t splitwidth = 0xffffffff;

74/*% opcode text */
75static const char * const opcodetext[] = {
76 "QUERY",
77 "IQUERY",
78 "STATUS",
79 "RESERVED3",
80 "NOTIFY",
81 "UPDATE",
82 "RESERVED6",
83 "RESERVED7",
84 "RESERVED8",
85 "RESERVED9",
86 "RESERVED10",
87 "RESERVED11",
88 "RESERVED12",
89 "RESERVED13",
90 "RESERVED14",
91 "RESERVED15"
92};
93
94static const char *
95rcode_totext(dns_rcode_t rcode) {
96 static char buf[64];
97 isc_buffer_t b;
98 isc_result_t result;
99
100 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
101 isc_buffer_init(&b, buf + 1, sizeof(buf) - 2);
102 result = dns_rcode_totext(rcode, &b);
103 RUNTIME_CHECK(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
104 if (strspn(buf + 1, "0123456789") == strlen(buf + 1)) {
105 buf[0] = '?';
106 return(buf);
107 }
108 return (buf + 1);
109}
110
111/*% print usage */
112static void
113print_usage(FILE *fp) {
114 fputs(
115"Usage: dig [@global-server] [domain] [q-type] [q-class] {q-opt}\n"
116" {global-d-opt} host [@local-server] {local-d-opt}\n"
117" [ host [@local-server] {local-d-opt} [...]]\n", fp);
118}
119
120#if TARGET_OS_IPHONE
121static void usage(void) {
122 fprintf(stderr, "Press <Help> for complete list of options\n");
123}
124#else
125ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_PRE static void
126usage(void) ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_POST;
127
128static void
129usage(void) {
130 print_usage(stderr);
131 fputs("\nUse \"dig -h\" (or \"dig -h | more\") "
132 "for complete list of options\n", stderr);
133 exit(1);
134}
135#endif
136
137/*% version */
138static void
139version(void) {
140 fputs("DiG " VERSION "\n", stderr);
141}
142
143/*% help */
144static void
145help(void) {
146 print_usage(stdout);
147 fputs(
148"Where: domain is in the Domain Name System\n"
149" q-class is one of (in,hs,ch,...) [default: in]\n"
150" q-type is one of (a,any,mx,ns,soa,hinfo,axfr,txt,...) [default:a]\n"
151" (Use ixfr=version for type ixfr)\n"
152" q-opt is one of:\n"
153" -4 (use IPv4 query transport only)\n"
154" -6 (use IPv6 query transport only)\n"
155" -b address[#port] (bind to source address/port)\n"
156" -c class (specify query class)\n"
157" -f filename (batch mode)\n"
158" -k keyfile (specify tsig key file)\n"
159" -m (enable memory usage debugging)\n"
160" -p port (specify port number)\n"
161" -q name (specify query name)\n"
162" -r (do not read ~/.digrc)\n"
163" -t type (specify query type)\n"
164" -u (display times in usec instead of msec)\n"
165" -x dot-notation (shortcut for reverse lookups)\n"
166" -y [hmac:]name:key (specify named base64 tsig key)\n"
167" d-opt is of the form +keyword[=value], where keyword is:\n"
168" +[no]aaflag (Set AA flag in query (+[no]aaflag))\n"
169" +[no]aaonly (Set AA flag in query (+[no]aaflag))\n"
170" +[no]additional (Control display of additional section)\n"
171" +[no]adflag (Set AD flag in query (default on))\n"
172" +[no]all (Set or clear all display flags)\n"
173" +[no]answer (Control display of answer section)\n"
174" +[no]authority (Control display of authority section)\n"
175" +[no]badcookie (Retry BADCOOKIE responses)\n"
176" +[no]besteffort (Try to parse even illegal messages)\n"
177" +bufsize=### (Set EDNS0 Max UDP packet size)\n"
178" +[no]cdflag (Set checking disabled flag in query)\n"
179" +[no]class (Control display of class in records)\n"
180" +[no]cmd (Control display of command line)\n"
181" +[no]comments (Control display of comment lines)\n"
182" +[no]cookie (Add a COOKIE option to the request)\n"
183" +[no]crypto (Control display of cryptographic "
184 "fields in records)\n"
185" +[no]defname (Use search list (+[no]search))\n"
186" +[no]dnssec (Request DNSSEC records)\n"
187" +domain=### (Set default domainname)\n"
188" +[no]dscp[=###] (Set the DSCP value to ### [0..63])\n"
189" +[no]edns[=###] (Set EDNS version) [0]\n"
190" +ednsflags=### (Set EDNS flag bits)\n"
191" +[no]ednsnegotiation (Set EDNS version negotiation)\n"
192" +ednsopt=###[:value] (Send specified EDNS option)\n"
193" +noednsopt (Clear list of +ednsopt options)\n"
194" +[no]expire (Request time to expire)\n"
195" +[no]fail (Don't try next server on SERVFAIL)\n"
196" +[no]header-only (Send query without a question section)\n"
197" +[no]identify (ID responders in short answers)\n"
198#ifdef HAVE_LIBIDN2
199" +[no]idnin (Parse IDN names [default=on on tty])\n"
200" +[no]idnout (Convert IDN response [default=on on tty])\n"
201#endif
202" +[no]ignore (Don't revert to TCP for TC responses.)\n"
203" +[no]keepalive (Request EDNS TCP keepalive)\n"
204" +[no]keepopen (Keep the TCP socket open between queries)\n"
205" +[no]mapped (Allow mapped IPv4 over IPv6)\n"
206" +[no]multiline (Print records in an expanded format)\n"
207" +ndots=### (Set search NDOTS value)\n"
208" +[no]nsid (Request Name Server ID)\n"
209" +[no]nssearch (Search all authoritative nameservers)\n"
210" +[no]onesoa (AXFR prints only one soa record)\n"
211" +[no]opcode=### (Set the opcode of the request)\n"
212" +padding=### (Set padding block size [0])\n"
213" +[no]qr (Print question before sending)\n"
214" +[no]question (Control display of question section)\n"
215" +[no]raflag (Set RA flag in query (+[no]raflag))\n"
216" +[no]rdflag (Recursive mode (+[no]recurse))\n"
217" +[no]recurse (Recursive mode (+[no]rdflag))\n"
218" +retry=### (Set number of UDP retries) [2]\n"
219" +[no]rrcomments (Control display of per-record "
220 "comments)\n"
221" +[no]search (Set whether to use searchlist)\n"
222" +[no]short (Display nothing except short\n"
223" form of answer)\n"
224" +[no]showsearch (Search with intermediate results)\n"
225" +[no]split=## (Split hex/base64 fields into chunks)\n"
226" +[no]stats (Control display of statistics)\n"
227" +subnet=addr (Set edns-client-subnet option)\n"
228" +[no]tcflag (Set TC flag in query (+[no]tcflag))\n"
229" +[no]tcp (TCP mode (+[no]vc))\n"
230" +timeout=### (Set query timeout) [5]\n"
231" +[no]trace (Trace delegation down from root [+dnssec])\n"
232" +tries=### (Set number of UDP attempts) [3]\n"
233" +[no]ttlid (Control display of ttls in records)\n"
234" +[no]ttlunits (Display TTLs in human-readable units)\n"
235" +[no]unknownformat (Print RDATA in RFC 3597 \"unknown\" format)\n"
236" +[no]vc (TCP mode (+[no]tcp))\n"
237" +[no]zflag (Set Z flag in query)\n"
238" global d-opts and servers (before host name) affect all queries.\n"
239" local d-opts and servers (after host name) affect only that lookup.\n"
240" -h (print help and exit)\n"
241" -v (print version and exit)\n",
242 stdout);
243}
244
245/*%
246 * Callback from dighost.c to print the received message.
247 */
248static void
249received(unsigned int bytes, isc_sockaddr_t *from, dig_query_t *query) {
250 uint64_t diff;
251 time_t tnow;
252 struct tm tmnow;
253#ifdef WIN32
254 wchar_t time_str[100];
255#else
256 char time_str[100];
257#endif
258 char fromtext[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
259
260 isc_sockaddr_format(from, fromtext, sizeof(fromtext));
261
262 if (query->lookup->stats && !short_form) {
263 diff = isc_time_microdiff(&query->time_recv, &query->time_sent);
264 if (query->lookup->use_usec)
265 printf(";; Query time: %ld usec\n", (long) diff);
266 else
267 printf(";; Query time: %ld msec\n", (long) diff / 1000);
268 printf(";; SERVER: %s(%s)\n", fromtext, query->servname);
269 time(&tnow);
270#if !defined(WIN32)
271 (void)localtime_r(&tnow, &tmnow);
272#else
273 tmnow = *localtime(&tnow);
274#endif
275
276#ifdef WIN32
277 /*
278 * On Windows, time zone name ("%Z") may be a localized
279 * wide-character string, which strftime() handles incorrectly.
280 */
281 if (wcsftime(time_str, sizeof(time_str)/sizeof(time_str[0]),
282 L"%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Z %Y", &tmnow) > 0U)
283 printf(";; WHEN: %ls\n", time_str);
284#else
285 if (strftime(time_str, sizeof(time_str),
286 "%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Z %Y", &tmnow) > 0U)
287 printf(";; WHEN: %s\n", time_str);
288#endif
289 if (query->lookup->doing_xfr) {
290 printf(";; XFR size: %u records (messages %u, "
291 "bytes %" PRIu64 ")\n",
292 query->rr_count, query->msg_count,
293 query->byte_count);
294 } else {
295 printf(";; MSG SIZE rcvd: %u\n", bytes);
296 }
297 if (tsigkey != NULL) {
298 if (!validated)
299 puts(";; WARNING -- Some TSIG could not "
300 "be validated");
301 }
302 if ((tsigkey == NULL) && (keysecret[0] != 0)) {
303 puts(";; WARNING -- TSIG key was not used.");
304 }
305 puts("");
306 } else if (query->lookup->identify && !short_form) {
307 diff = isc_time_microdiff(&query->time_recv, &query->time_sent);
308 if (query->lookup->use_usec)
309 printf(";; Received %" PRIu64 " bytes "
310 "from %s(%s) in %ld us\n\n",
311 query->lookup->doing_xfr
312 ? query->byte_count
313 : (uint64_t)bytes,
314 fromtext, query->userarg, (long) diff);
315 else
316 printf(";; Received %" PRIu64 " bytes "
317 "from %s(%s) in %ld ms\n\n",
318 query->lookup->doing_xfr
319 ? query->byte_count
320 : (uint64_t)bytes,
321 fromtext, query->userarg, (long) diff / 1000);
322 }
323}
324
325/*
326 * Callback from dighost.c to print that it is trying a server.
327 * Not used in dig.
328 * XXX print_trying
329 */
330static void
331trying(char *frm, dig_lookup_t *lookup) {
332 UNUSED(frm);
333 UNUSED(lookup);
334}
335
336/*%
337 * Internal print routine used to print short form replies.
338 */
339static isc_result_t
340say_message(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dig_query_t *query, isc_buffer_t *buf) {
341 isc_result_t result;
342 uint64_t diff;
343 char store[sizeof(" in 18446744073709551616 us.")];
344 unsigned int styleflags = 0;
345
346 if (query->lookup->trace || query->lookup->ns_search_only) {
347 result = dns_rdatatype_totext(rdata->type, buf);
348 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
349 return (result);
350 ADD_STRING(buf, " ");
351 }
352
353 /* Turn on rrcomments if explicitly enabled */
354 if (query->lookup->rrcomments > 0)
355 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_RRCOMMENT;
356 if (query->lookup->nocrypto)
357 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_NOCRYPTO;
358 if (query->lookup->print_unknown_format)
359 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_UNKNOWNFORMAT;
360 result = dns_rdata_tofmttext(rdata, NULL, styleflags, 0,
361 splitwidth, " ", buf);
362 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
363 return (result);
364 check_result(result, "dns_rdata_totext");
365 if (query->lookup->identify) {
366
367 diff = isc_time_microdiff(&query->time_recv, &query->time_sent);
368 ADD_STRING(buf, " from server ");
369 ADD_STRING(buf, query->servname);
370 if (query->lookup->use_usec) {
371 snprintf(store, sizeof(store), " in %" PRIu64 " us.", diff);
372 } else {
373 snprintf(store, sizeof(store), " in %" PRIu64 " ms.", diff / 1000);
374 }
375 ADD_STRING(buf, store);
376 }
377 ADD_STRING(buf, "\n");
378 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
379}
380
381/*%
382 * short_form message print handler. Calls above say_message()
383 */
384static isc_result_t
385short_answer(dns_message_t *msg, dns_messagetextflag_t flags,
386 isc_buffer_t *buf, dig_query_t *query)
387{
388 dns_name_t *name;
389 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset;
390 isc_result_t result, loopresult;
391 dns_name_t empty_name;
392 dns_rdata_t rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
393
394 UNUSED(flags);
395
396 dns_name_init(&empty_name, NULL);
397 result = dns_message_firstname(msg, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
398 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE)
399 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
400 else if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
401 return (result);
402
403 for (;;) {
404 name = NULL;
405 dns_message_currentname(msg, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER, &name);
406
407 for (rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(name->list);
408 rdataset != NULL;
409 rdataset = ISC_LIST_NEXT(rdataset, link)) {
410 loopresult = dns_rdataset_first(rdataset);
411 while (loopresult == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
412 dns_rdataset_current(rdataset, &rdata);
413 result = say_message(&rdata, query,
414 buf);
415 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
416 return (result);
417 check_result(result, "say_message");
418 loopresult = dns_rdataset_next(rdataset);
419 dns_rdata_reset(&rdata);
420 }
421 }
422 result = dns_message_nextname(msg, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
423 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE)
424 break;
425 else if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
426 return (result);
427 }
428
429 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
430}
431
432static bool
433isdotlocal(dns_message_t *msg) {
434 isc_result_t result;
435 static unsigned char local_ndata[] = { "\005local\0" };
436 static unsigned char local_offsets[] = { 0, 6 };
437 static dns_name_t local =
438 DNS_NAME_INITABSOLUTE(local_ndata, local_offsets);
439
440 for (result = dns_message_firstname(msg, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION);
441 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
442 result = dns_message_nextname(msg, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION))
443 {
444 dns_name_t *name = NULL;
445 dns_message_currentname(msg, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION, &name);
446 if (dns_name_issubdomain(name, &local))
447 return (true);
448 }
449 return (false);
450}
451
452/*
453 * Callback from dighost.c to print the reply from a server
454 */
455static isc_result_t
456printmessage(dig_query_t *query, dns_message_t *msg, bool headers) {
457 isc_result_t result;
458 dns_messagetextflag_t flags;
459 isc_buffer_t *buf = NULL;
460 unsigned int len = OUTPUTBUF;
461 dns_master_style_t *style = NULL;
462 unsigned int styleflags = 0;
463
464 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_REL_OWNER;
465 if (query->lookup->comments)
466 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_COMMENT;
467 if (query->lookup->print_unknown_format)
468 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_UNKNOWNFORMAT;
469 /* Turn on rrcomments if explicitly enabled */
470 if (query->lookup->rrcomments > 0)
471 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_RRCOMMENT;
472 if (query->lookup->ttlunits)
473 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_TTL_UNITS;
474 if (query->lookup->nottl)
475 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_NO_TTL;
476 if (query->lookup->noclass)
477 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_NO_CLASS;
478 if (query->lookup->nocrypto)
479 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_NOCRYPTO;
480 if (query->lookup->multiline) {
481 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_OMIT_OWNER;
482 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_OMIT_CLASS;
483 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_REL_DATA;
484 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_OMIT_TTL;
485 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_TTL;
486 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_MULTILINE;
487 /* Turn on rrcomments unless explicitly disabled */
488 if (query->lookup->rrcomments >= 0)
489 styleflags |= DNS_STYLEFLAG_RRCOMMENT;
490 }
491 if (query->lookup->multiline ||
492 (query->lookup->nottl && query->lookup->noclass))
493 result = dns_master_stylecreate(&style, styleflags,
494 24, 24, 24, 32, 80, 8,
495 splitwidth, mctx);
496 else if (query->lookup->nottl || query->lookup->noclass)
497 result = dns_master_stylecreate(&style, styleflags,
498 24, 24, 32, 40, 80, 8,
499 splitwidth, mctx);
500 else
501 result = dns_master_stylecreate(&style, styleflags,
502 24, 32, 40, 48, 80, 8,
503 splitwidth, mctx);
504 check_result(result, "dns_master_stylecreate");
505
506 if (query->lookup->cmdline[0] != 0) {
507 if (!short_form)
508 fputs(query->lookup->cmdline, stdout);
509 query->lookup->cmdline[0]=0;
510 }
511 debug("printmessage(%s %s %s)", headers ? "headers" : "noheaders",
512 query->lookup->comments ? "comments" : "nocomments",
513 short_form ? "short_form" : "long_form");
514
515 flags = 0;
516 if (!headers) {
517 flags |= DNS_MESSAGETEXTFLAG_NOHEADERS;
518 flags |= DNS_MESSAGETEXTFLAG_NOCOMMENTS;
519 }
520 if (query->lookup->onesoa &&
521 query->lookup->rdtype == dns_rdatatype_axfr)
522 flags |= (query->msg_count == 0) ? DNS_MESSAGETEXTFLAG_ONESOA :
523 DNS_MESSAGETEXTFLAG_OMITSOA;
524 if (!query->lookup->comments)
525 flags |= DNS_MESSAGETEXTFLAG_NOCOMMENTS;
526
527 result = isc_buffer_allocate(mctx, &buf, len);
528 check_result(result, "isc_buffer_allocate");
529
530 if (query->lookup->comments && !short_form) {
531 if (query->lookup->cmdline[0] != 0)
532 printf("; %s\n", query->lookup->cmdline);
533 if (msg == query->lookup->sendmsg)
534 printf(";; Sending:\n");
535 else
536 printf(";; Got answer:\n");
537
538 if (headers) {
539 if (isdotlocal(msg)) {
540 printf(";; WARNING: .local is reserved for "
541 "Multicast DNS\n;; You are currently "
542 "testing what happens when an mDNS "
543 "query is leaked to DNS\n");
544 }
545 printf(";; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: %s, status: %s, "
546 "id: %u\n",
547 opcodetext[msg->opcode],
548 rcode_totext(msg->rcode),
549 msg->id);
550 printf(";; flags:");
551 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_QR) != 0)
552 printf(" qr");
553 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_AA) != 0)
554 printf(" aa");
555 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_TC) != 0)
556 printf(" tc");
557 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RD) != 0)
558 printf(" rd");
559 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RA) != 0)
560 printf(" ra");
561 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_AD) != 0)
562 printf(" ad");
563 if ((msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_CD) != 0)
564 printf(" cd");
565 if ((msg->flags & 0x0040U) != 0)
566 printf("; MBZ: 0x4");
567
568 printf("; QUERY: %u, ANSWER: %u, "
569 "AUTHORITY: %u, ADDITIONAL: %u\n",
570 msg->counts[DNS_SECTION_QUESTION],
571 msg->counts[DNS_SECTION_ANSWER],
572 msg->counts[DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY],
573 msg->counts[DNS_SECTION_ADDITIONAL]);
574
575 if (msg != query->lookup->sendmsg &&
576 (msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RD) != 0 &&
577 (msg->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RA) == 0)
578 printf(";; WARNING: recursion requested "
579 "but not available\n");
580 }
581 if (msg != query->lookup->sendmsg &&
582 query->lookup->edns != -1 && msg->opt == NULL &&
583 (msg->rcode == dns_rcode_formerr ||
584 msg->rcode == dns_rcode_notimp))
585 printf("\n;; WARNING: EDNS query returned status "
586 "%s - retry with '%s+noedns'\n",
587 rcode_totext(msg->rcode),
588 query->lookup->dnssec ? "+nodnssec ": "");
589 if (msg != query->lookup->sendmsg && extrabytes != 0U)
590 printf(";; WARNING: Message has %u extra byte%s at "
591 "end\n", extrabytes, extrabytes != 0 ? "s" : "");
592 }
593
594repopulate_buffer:
595
596 if (query->lookup->comments && headers && !short_form) {
597 result = dns_message_pseudosectiontotext(msg,
598 DNS_PSEUDOSECTION_OPT,
599 style, flags, buf);
600 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE) {
601buftoosmall:
602 len += OUTPUTBUF;
603 isc_buffer_free(&buf);
604 result = isc_buffer_allocate(mctx, &buf, len);
605 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
606 goto repopulate_buffer;
607 else
608 goto cleanup;
609 }
610 check_result(result,
611 "dns_message_pseudosectiontotext");
612 }
613
614 if (query->lookup->section_question && headers) {
615 if (!short_form) {
616 result = dns_message_sectiontotext(msg,
617 DNS_SECTION_QUESTION,
618 style, flags, buf);
619 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
620 goto buftoosmall;
621 check_result(result, "dns_message_sectiontotext");
622 }
623 }
624 if (query->lookup->section_answer) {
625 if (!short_form) {
626 result = dns_message_sectiontotext(msg,
627 DNS_SECTION_ANSWER,
628 style, flags, buf);
629 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
630 goto buftoosmall;
631 check_result(result, "dns_message_sectiontotext");
632 } else {
633 result = short_answer(msg, flags, buf, query);
634 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
635 goto buftoosmall;
636 check_result(result, "short_answer");
637 }
638 }
639 if (query->lookup->section_authority) {
640 if (!short_form) {
641 result = dns_message_sectiontotext(msg,
642 DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY,
643 style, flags, buf);
644 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
645 goto buftoosmall;
646 check_result(result, "dns_message_sectiontotext");
647 }
648 }
649 if (query->lookup->section_additional) {
650 if (!short_form) {
651 result = dns_message_sectiontotext(msg,
652 DNS_SECTION_ADDITIONAL,
653 style, flags, buf);
654 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
655 goto buftoosmall;
656 check_result(result, "dns_message_sectiontotext");
657 /*
658 * Only print the signature on the first record.
659 */
660 if (headers) {
661 result = dns_message_pseudosectiontotext(
662 msg,
663 DNS_PSEUDOSECTION_TSIG,
664 style, flags, buf);
665 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
666 goto buftoosmall;
667 check_result(result,
668 "dns_message_pseudosectiontotext");
669 result = dns_message_pseudosectiontotext(
670 msg,
671 DNS_PSEUDOSECTION_SIG0,
672 style, flags, buf);
673 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE)
674 goto buftoosmall;
675 check_result(result,
676 "dns_message_pseudosectiontotext");
677 }
678 }
679 }
680
681 if (headers && query->lookup->comments && !short_form)
682 printf("\n");
683
684 printf("%.*s", (int)isc_buffer_usedlength(buf),
685 (char *)isc_buffer_base(buf));
686 isc_buffer_free(&buf);
687
688cleanup:
689 if (style != NULL)
690 dns_master_styledestroy(&style, mctx);
691 return (result);
692}
693
694/*%
695 * print the greeting message when the program first starts up.
696 */
697static void
698printgreeting(int argc, char **argv, dig_lookup_t *lookup) {
699 int i;
700 static bool first = true;
701 char append[MXNAME];
702
703 if (printcmd) {
704 snprintf(lookup->cmdline, sizeof(lookup->cmdline),
705 "%s; <<>> DiG " VERSION " <<>>",
706 first?"\n":"");
707 i = 1;
708 while (i < argc) {
709 snprintf(append, sizeof(append), " %s", argv[i++]);
710 strlcat(lookup->cmdline, append,
711 sizeof(lookup->cmdline));
712 }
713 strlcat(lookup->cmdline, "\n", sizeof(lookup->cmdline));
714 if (first && addresscount != 0) {
715 snprintf(append, sizeof(append),
716 "; (%d server%s found)\n",
717 addresscount,
718 addresscount > 1 ? "s" : "");
719 strlcat(lookup->cmdline, append,
720 sizeof(lookup->cmdline));
721 }
722 if (first) {
723 snprintf(append, sizeof(append),
724 ";; global options:%s%s\n",
725 short_form ? " +short" : "",
726 printcmd ? " +cmd" : "");
727 first = false;
728 strlcat(lookup->cmdline, append,
729 sizeof(lookup->cmdline));
730 }
731 }
732}
733
734/*%
735 * We're not using isc_commandline_parse() here since the command line
736 * syntax of dig is quite a bit different from that which can be described
737 * by that routine.
738 * XXX doc options
739 */
740
741static void
742plus_option(char *option, bool is_batchfile,
743 dig_lookup_t *lookup)
744{
745 isc_result_t result;
746 char *cmd, *value, *last = NULL, *code, *extra;
747 uint32_t num;
748 bool state = true;
749 size_t n;
750
751 INSIST(option != NULL);
752
753 if ((cmd = strtok_r(option, "=", &last)) == NULL) {
754 printf(";; Invalid option %s\n", option);
755 return;
756 }
757 if (strncasecmp(cmd, "no", 2)==0) {
758 cmd += 2;
759 state = false;
760 }
761 /* parse the rest of the string */
762 value = strtok_r(NULL, "", &last);
763
764#define FULLCHECK(A) \
765 do { \
766 size_t _l = strlen(cmd); \
767 if (_l >= sizeof(A) || strncasecmp(cmd, A, _l) != 0) \
768 goto invalid_option; \
769 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
770#define FULLCHECK2(A, B) \
771 do { \
772 size_t _l = strlen(cmd); \
773 if ((_l >= sizeof(A) || strncasecmp(cmd, A, _l) != 0) && \
774 (_l >= sizeof(B) || strncasecmp(cmd, B, _l) != 0)) \
775 goto invalid_option; \
776 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
777
778 switch (cmd[0]) {
779 case 'a':
780 switch (cmd[1]) {
781 case 'a': /* aaonly / aaflag */
782 FULLCHECK2("aaonly", "aaflag");
783 lookup->aaonly = state;
784 break;
785 case 'd':
786 switch (cmd[2]) {
787 case 'd': /* additional */
788 FULLCHECK("additional");
789 lookup->section_additional = state;
790 break;
791 case 'f': /* adflag */
792 case '\0': /* +ad is a synonym for +adflag */
793 FULLCHECK("adflag");
794 lookup->adflag = state;
795 break;
796 default:
797 goto invalid_option;
798 }
799 break;
800 case 'l': /* all */
801 FULLCHECK("all");
802 lookup->section_question = state;
803 lookup->section_authority = state;
804 lookup->section_answer = state;
805 lookup->section_additional = state;
806 lookup->comments = state;
807 lookup->stats = state;
808 printcmd = state;
809 break;
810 case 'n': /* answer */
811 FULLCHECK("answer");
812 lookup->section_answer = state;
813 break;
814 case 'u': /* authority */
815 FULLCHECK("authority");
816 lookup->section_authority = state;
817 break;
818 default:
819 goto invalid_option;
820 }
821 break;
822 case 'b':
823 switch (cmd[1]) {
824 case 'a':/* badcookie */
825 FULLCHECK("badcookie");
826 lookup->badcookie = state;
827 break;
828 case 'e':/* besteffort */
829 FULLCHECK("besteffort");
830 lookup->besteffort = state;
831 break;
832 case 'u':/* bufsize */
833 FULLCHECK("bufsize");
834 if (value == NULL)
835 goto need_value;
836 if (!state)
837 goto invalid_option;
838 result = parse_uint(&num, value, COMMSIZE,
839 "buffer size");
840 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
841 warn("Couldn't parse buffer size");
842 goto exit_or_usage;
843 }
844 lookup->udpsize = num;
845 break;
846 default:
847 goto invalid_option;
848 }
849 break;
850 case 'c':
851 switch (cmd[1]) {
852 case 'd':/* cdflag */
853 switch (cmd[2]) {
854 case 'f': /* cdflag */
855 case '\0': /* +cd is a synonym for +cdflag */
856 FULLCHECK("cdflag");
857 lookup->cdflag = state;
858 break;
859 default:
860 goto invalid_option;
861 }
862 break;
863 case 'l': /* class */
864 /* keep +cl for backwards compatibility */
865 FULLCHECK2("cl", "class");
866 lookup->noclass = !state;
867 break;
868 case 'm': /* cmd */
869 FULLCHECK("cmd");
870 printcmd = state;
871 break;
872 case 'o': /* comments */
873 switch (cmd[2]) {
874 case 'm':
875 FULLCHECK("comments");
876 lookup->comments = state;
877 if (lookup == default_lookup)
878 pluscomm = state;
879 break;
880 case 'o': /* cookie */
881 FULLCHECK("cookie");
882 if (state && lookup->edns == -1)
883 lookup->edns = 0;
884 lookup->sendcookie = state;
885 if (value != NULL) {
886 n = strlcpy(hexcookie, value,
887 sizeof(hexcookie));
888 if (n >= sizeof(hexcookie)) {
889 warn("COOKIE data too large");
890 goto exit_or_usage;
891 }
892 lookup->cookie = hexcookie;
893 } else
894 lookup->cookie = NULL;
895 break;
896 default:
897 goto invalid_option;
898 }
899 break;
900 case 'r':
901 FULLCHECK("crypto");
902 lookup->nocrypto = !state;
903 break;
904 default:
905 goto invalid_option;
906 }
907 break;
908 case 'd':
909 switch (cmd[1]) {
910 case 'e': /* defname */
911 FULLCHECK("defname");
912 if (!lookup->trace) {
913 usesearch = state;
914 }
915 break;
916 case 'n': /* dnssec */
917 FULLCHECK("dnssec");
918 dnssec:
919 if (state && lookup->edns == -1)
920 lookup->edns = 0;
921 lookup->dnssec = state;
922 break;
923 case 'o': /* domain ... but treat "do" as synonym for dnssec */
924 if (cmd[2] == '\0')
925 goto dnssec;
926 FULLCHECK("domain");
927 if (value == NULL)
928 goto need_value;
929 if (!state)
930 goto invalid_option;
931 strlcpy(domainopt, value, sizeof(domainopt));
932 break;
933 case 's': /* dscp */
934 FULLCHECK("dscp");
935 if (!state) {
936 lookup->dscp = -1;
937 break;
938 }
939 if (value == NULL)
940 goto need_value;
941 result = parse_uint(&num, value, 0x3f, "DSCP");
942 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
943 warn("Couldn't parse DSCP value");
944 goto exit_or_usage;
945 }
946 lookup->dscp = num;
947 break;
948 default:
949 goto invalid_option;
950 }
951 break;
952 case 'e':
953 switch (cmd[1]) {
954 case 'd':
955 switch(cmd[2]) {
956 case 'n':
957 switch (cmd[3]) {
958 case 's':
959 switch (cmd[4]) {
960 case 0:
961 FULLCHECK("edns");
962 if (!state) {
963 lookup->edns = -1;
964 break;
965 }
966 if (value == NULL) {
967 lookup->edns = 0;
968 break;
969 }
970 result = parse_uint(&num,
971 value,
972 255,
973 "edns");
974 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
975 warn("Couldn't parse "
976 "edns");
977 goto exit_or_usage;
978 }
979 lookup->edns = num;
980 break;
981 case 'f':
982 FULLCHECK("ednsflags");
983 if (!state) {
984 lookup->ednsflags = 0;
985 break;
986 }
987 if (value == NULL) {
988 lookup->ednsflags = 0;
989 break;
990 }
991 result = parse_xint(&num,
992 value,
993 0xffff,
994 "ednsflags");
995 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
996 warn("Couldn't parse "
997 "ednsflags");
998 goto exit_or_usage;
999 }
1000 lookup->ednsflags = num;
1001 break;
1002 case 'n':
1003 FULLCHECK("ednsnegotiation");
1004 lookup->ednsneg = state;
1005 break;
1006 case 'o':
1007 FULLCHECK("ednsopt");
1008 if (!state) {
1009 lookup->ednsoptscnt = 0;
1010 break;
1011 }
1012 code = NULL;
1013 if (value != NULL) {
1014 code = strtok_r(value,
1015 ":",
1016 &last);
1017 }
1018 if (code == NULL) {
1019 warn("ednsopt no "
1020 "code point "
1021 "specified");
1022 goto exit_or_usage;
1023 }
1024 extra = strtok_r(NULL, "\0",
1025 &last);
1026 save_opt(lookup, code, extra);
1027 break;
1028 default:
1029 goto invalid_option;
1030 }
1031 break;
1032 default:
1033 goto invalid_option;
1034 }
1035 break;
1036 default:
1037 goto invalid_option;
1038 }
1039 break;
1040 case 'x':
1041 FULLCHECK("expire");
1042 lookup->expire = state;
1043 break;
1044 default:
1045 goto invalid_option;
1046 }
1047 break;
1048 case 'f': /* fail */
1049 FULLCHECK("fail");
1050 lookup->servfail_stops = state;
1051 break;
1052 case 'h':
1053 FULLCHECK("header-only");
1054 lookup->header_only = state;
1055 break;
1056 case 'i':
1057 switch (cmd[1]) {
1058 case 'd': /* identify */
1059 switch (cmd[2]) {
1060 case 'e':
1061 FULLCHECK("identify");
1062 lookup->identify = state;
1063 break;
1064 case 'n':
1065 switch (cmd[3]) {
1066 case 'i':
1067 FULLCHECK("idnin");
1068#ifndef HAVE_LIBIDN2
1069 fprintf(stderr, ";; IDN input support"
1070 " not enabled\n");
1071#else
1072 lookup->idnin = state;
1073#endif
1074 break;
1075 case 'o':
1076 FULLCHECK("idnout");
1077#ifndef HAVE_LIBIDN2
1078 fprintf(stderr, ";; IDN output support"
1079 " not enabled\n");
1080#else
1081 lookup->idnout = state;
1082#endif
1083 break;
1084 default:
1085 goto invalid_option;
1086 }
1087 break;
1088 default:
1089 goto invalid_option;
1090 }
1091 break;
1092 case 'g': /* ignore */
1093 default: /*
1094 * Inherits default for compatibility (+[no]i*).
1095 */
1096 FULLCHECK("ignore");
1097 lookup->ignore = state;
1098 }
1099 break;
1100 case 'k':
1101 switch (cmd[1]) {
1102 case 'e':
1103 switch (cmd[2]) {
1104 case 'e':
1105 switch (cmd[3]) {
1106 case 'p':
1107 switch (cmd[4]) {
1108 case 'a':
1109 FULLCHECK("keepalive");
1110 lookup->tcp_keepalive = state;
1111 break;
1112 case 'o':
1113 FULLCHECK("keepopen");
1114 keep_open = state;
1115 break;
1116 default:
1117 goto invalid_option;
1118 }
1119 break;
1120 default:
1121 goto invalid_option;
1122 }
1123 break;
1124 default:
1125 goto invalid_option;
1126 }
1127 break;
1128 default:
1129 goto invalid_option;
1130 }
1131 break;
1132 case 'm': /* multiline */
1133 switch (cmd[1]) {
1134 case 'a':
1135 FULLCHECK("mapped");
1136 lookup->mapped = state;
1137 break;
1138 case 'u':
1139 FULLCHECK("multiline");
1140 lookup->multiline = state;
1141 break;
1142 default:
1143 goto invalid_option;
1144 }
1145 break;
1146 case 'n':
1147 switch (cmd[1]) {
1148 case 'd': /* ndots */
1149 FULLCHECK("ndots");
1150 if (value == NULL)
1151 goto need_value;
1152 if (!state)
1153 goto invalid_option;
1154 result = parse_uint(&num, value, MAXNDOTS, "ndots");
1155 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1156 warn("Couldn't parse ndots");
1157 goto exit_or_usage;
1158 }
1159 ndots = num;
1160 break;
1161 case 's':
1162 switch (cmd[2]) {
1163 case 'i': /* nsid */
1164 FULLCHECK("nsid");
1165 if (state && lookup->edns == -1)
1166 lookup->edns = 0;
1167 lookup->nsid = state;
1168 break;
1169 case 's': /* nssearch */
1170 FULLCHECK("nssearch");
1171 lookup->ns_search_only = state;
1172 if (state) {
1173 lookup->trace_root = true;
1174 lookup->recurse = true;
1175 lookup->identify = true;
1176 lookup->stats = false;
1177 lookup->comments = false;
1178 lookup->section_additional = false;
1179 lookup->section_authority = false;
1180 lookup->section_question = false;
1181 lookup->rdtype = dns_rdatatype_ns;
1182 lookup->rdtypeset = true;
1183 short_form = true;
1184 lookup->rrcomments = 0;
1185 }
1186 break;
1187 default:
1188 goto invalid_option;
1189 }
1190 break;
1191 default:
1192 goto invalid_option;
1193 }
1194 break;
1195 case 'o':
1196 switch (cmd[1]) {
1197 case 'n':
1198 FULLCHECK("onesoa");
1199 lookup->onesoa = state;
1200 break;
1201 case 'p':
1202 FULLCHECK("opcode");
1203 if (!state) {
1204 lookup->opcode = 0; /* default - query */
1205 break;
1206 }
1207 if (value == NULL)
1208 goto need_value;
1209 for (num = 0;
1210 num < sizeof(opcodetext)/sizeof(opcodetext[0]);
1211 num++) {
1212 if (strcasecmp(opcodetext[num], value) == 0)
1213 break;
1214 }
1215 if (num < 16) {
1216 lookup->opcode = (dns_opcode_t)num;
1217 break;
1218 }
1219 result = parse_uint(&num, value, 15, "opcode");
1220 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1221 warn("Couldn't parse opcode");
1222 goto exit_or_usage;
1223 }
1224 lookup->opcode = (dns_opcode_t)num;
1225 break;
1226 default:
1227 goto invalid_option;
1228 }
1229 break;
1230 case 'p':
1231 FULLCHECK("padding");
1232 if (state && lookup->edns == -1)
1233 lookup->edns = 0;
1234 if (value == NULL)
1235 goto need_value;
1236 result = parse_uint(&num, value, 512, "padding");
1237 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1238 warn("Couldn't parse padding");
1239 goto exit_or_usage;
1240 }
1241 lookup->padding = (uint16_t)num;
1242 break;
1243 case 'q':
1244 switch (cmd[1]) {
1245 case 'r': /* qr */
1246 FULLCHECK("qr");
1247 lookup->qr = state;
1248 break;
1249 case 'u': /* question */
1250 FULLCHECK("question");
1251 lookup->section_question = state;
1252 if (lookup == default_lookup)
1253 plusquest = state;
1254 break;
1255 default:
1256 goto invalid_option;
1257 }
1258 break;
1259 case 'r':
1260 switch (cmd[1]) {
1261 case 'a': /* raflag */
1262 FULLCHECK("raflag");
1263 lookup->raflag = state;
1264 break;
1265 case 'd': /* rdflag */
1266 FULLCHECK("rdflag");
1267 lookup->recurse = state;
1268 break;
1269 case 'e':
1270 switch (cmd[2]) {
1271 case 'c': /* recurse */
1272 FULLCHECK("recurse");
1273 lookup->recurse = state;
1274 break;
1275 case 't': /* retry / retries */
1276 FULLCHECK2("retry", "retries");
1277 if (value == NULL)
1278 goto need_value;
1279 if (!state)
1280 goto invalid_option;
1281 result = parse_uint(&lookup->retries, value,
1282 MAXTRIES - 1, "retries");
1283 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1284 warn("Couldn't parse retries");
1285 goto exit_or_usage;
1286 }
1287 lookup->retries++;
1288 break;
1289 default:
1290 goto invalid_option;
1291 }
1292 break;
1293 case 'r': /* rrcomments */
1294 FULLCHECK("rrcomments");
1295 lookup->rrcomments = state ? 1 : -1;
1296 break;
1297 default:
1298 goto invalid_option;
1299 }
1300 break;
1301 case 's':
1302 switch (cmd[1]) {
1303 case 'e': /* search */
1304 FULLCHECK("search");
1305 if (!lookup->trace) {
1306 usesearch = state;
1307 }
1308 break;
1309 case 'h':
1310 if (cmd[2] != 'o')
1311 goto invalid_option;
1312 switch (cmd[3]) {
1313 case 'r': /* short */
1314 FULLCHECK("short");
1315 short_form = state;
1316 if (state) {
1317 printcmd = false;
1318 lookup->section_additional = false;
1319 lookup->section_answer = true;
1320 lookup->section_authority = false;
1321 lookup->section_question = false;
1322 lookup->comments = false;
1323 lookup->stats = false;
1324 lookup->rrcomments = -1;
1325 }
1326 break;
1327 case 'w': /* showsearch */
1328 FULLCHECK("showsearch");
1329 if (!lookup->trace) {
1330 showsearch = state;
1331 usesearch = state;
1332 }
1333 break;
1334 default:
1335 goto invalid_option;
1336 }
1337 break;
1338 case 'i': /* sigchase */
1339 FULLCHECK("sigchase");
1340 fprintf(stderr, ";; +sigchase option is deprecated");
1341 break;
1342 case 'p': /* split */
1343 FULLCHECK("split");
1344 if (value != NULL && !state)
1345 goto invalid_option;
1346 if (!state) {
1347 splitwidth = 0;
1348 break;
1349 } else if (value == NULL)
1350 break;
1351
1352 result = parse_uint(&splitwidth, value,
1353 1023, "split");
1354 if ((splitwidth % 4) != 0U) {
1355 splitwidth = ((splitwidth + 3) / 4) * 4;
1356 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, split must be "
1357 "a multiple of 4; adjusting "
1358 "to %u\n", splitwidth);
1359 }
1360 /*
1361 * There is an adjustment done in the
1362 * totext_<rrtype>() functions which causes
1363 * splitwidth to shrink. This is okay when we're
1364 * using the default width but incorrect in this
1365 * case, so we correct for it
1366 */
1367 if (splitwidth)
1368 splitwidth += 3;
1369 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1370 warn("Couldn't parse split");
1371 goto exit_or_usage;
1372 }
1373 break;
1374 case 't': /* stats */
1375 FULLCHECK("stats");
1376 lookup->stats = state;
1377 break;
1378 case 'u': /* subnet */
1379 FULLCHECK("subnet");
1380 if (state && value == NULL)
1381 goto need_value;
1382 if (!state) {
1383 if (lookup->ecs_addr != NULL) {
1384 isc_mem_free(mctx, lookup->ecs_addr);
1385 lookup->ecs_addr = NULL;
1386 }
1387 break;
1388 }
1389 if (lookup->edns == -1)
1390 lookup->edns = 0;
1391 if (lookup->ecs_addr != NULL) {
1392 isc_mem_free(mctx, lookup->ecs_addr);
1393 lookup->ecs_addr = NULL;
1394 }
1395 result = parse_netprefix(&lookup->ecs_addr, value);
1396 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1397 warn("Couldn't parse client");
1398 goto exit_or_usage;
1399 }
1400 break;
1401 default:
1402 goto invalid_option;
1403 }
1404 break;
1405 case 't':
1406 switch (cmd[1]) {
1407 case 'c': /* tcp */
1408 switch (cmd[2]) {
1409 case 'f':
1410 FULLCHECK("tcflag");
1411 lookup->tcflag = state;
1412 break;
1413 case 'p':
1414 FULLCHECK("tcp");
1415 if (!is_batchfile) {
1416 lookup->tcp_mode = state;
1417 lookup->tcp_mode_set = true;
1418 }
1419 break;
1420 default:
1421 goto invalid_option;
1422 }
1423 break;
1424 case 'i': /* timeout */
1425 FULLCHECK("timeout");
1426 if (value == NULL)
1427 goto need_value;
1428 if (!state)
1429 goto invalid_option;
1430 result = parse_uint(&timeout, value, MAXTIMEOUT,
1431 "timeout");
1432 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1433 warn("Couldn't parse timeout");
1434 goto exit_or_usage;
1435 }
1436 if (timeout == 0)
1437 timeout = 1;
1438 break;
1439 case 'o':
1440 FULLCHECK("topdown");
1441 fprintf(stderr, ";; +topdown option is deprecated");
1442 break;
1443 case 'r':
1444 switch (cmd[2]) {
1445 case 'a': /* trace */
1446 FULLCHECK("trace");
1447 lookup->trace = state;
1448 lookup->trace_root = state;
1449 if (state) {
1450 lookup->recurse = false;
1451 lookup->identify = true;
1452 lookup->comments = false;
1453 lookup->rrcomments = 0;
1454 lookup->stats = false;
1455 lookup->section_additional = false;
1456 lookup->section_authority = true;
1457 lookup->section_question = false;
1458 lookup->dnssec = true;
1459 lookup->sendcookie = true;
1460 usesearch = false;
1461 }
1462 break;
1463 case 'i': /* tries */
1464 FULLCHECK("tries");
1465 if (value == NULL)
1466 goto need_value;
1467 if (!state)
1468 goto invalid_option;
1469 result = parse_uint(&lookup->retries, value,
1470 MAXTRIES, "tries");
1471 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1472 warn("Couldn't parse tries");
1473 goto exit_or_usage;
1474 }
1475 if (lookup->retries == 0)
1476 lookup->retries = 1;
1477 break;
1478 case 'u': /* trusted-key */
1479 FULLCHECK("trusted-key");
1480 fprintf(stderr, ";; +trusted-key option is "
1481 "deprecated");
1482 break;
1483 default:
1484 goto invalid_option;
1485 }
1486 break;
1487 case 't':
1488 switch (cmd[2]) {
1489 case 'l':
1490 switch (cmd[3]) {
1491 case 0:
1492 case 'i': /* ttlid */
1493 FULLCHECK2("ttl", "ttlid");
1494 lookup->nottl = !state;
1495 break;
1496 case 'u': /* ttlunits */
1497 FULLCHECK("ttlunits");
1498 lookup->nottl = false;
1499 lookup->ttlunits = state;
1500 break;
1501 default:
1502 goto invalid_option;
1503 }
1504 break;
1505 default:
1506 goto invalid_option;
1507 }
1508 break;
1509 default:
1510 goto invalid_option;
1511 }
1512 break;
1513 case 'u':
1514 FULLCHECK("unknownformat");
1515 lookup->print_unknown_format = state;
1516 break;
1517 case 'v':
1518 FULLCHECK("vc");
1519 if (!is_batchfile) {
1520 lookup->tcp_mode = state;
1521 lookup->tcp_mode_set = true;
1522 }
1523 break;
1524 case 'z': /* zflag */
1525 FULLCHECK("zflag");
1526 lookup->zflag = state;
1527 break;
1528 default:
1529 invalid_option:
1530 need_value:
1531#if TARGET_OS_IPHONE
1532 exit_or_usage:
1533#endif
1534 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid option: +%s\n",
1535 option);
1536 usage();
1537 }
1538 return;
1539
1540#if ! TARGET_OS_IPHONE
1541 exit_or_usage:
1542 digexit();
1543#endif
1544}
1545
1546/*%
1547 * #true returned if value was used
1548 */
1549static const char *single_dash_opts = "46dhimnruv";
1550static const char *dash_opts = "46bcdfhikmnpqrtvyx";
1551static bool
1552dash_option(char *option, char *next, dig_lookup_t **lookup,
1553 bool *open_type_class, bool *need_clone,
1554 bool config_only, int argc, char **argv,
1555 bool *firstarg)
1556{
1557 char opt, *value, *ptr, *ptr2, *ptr3, *last;
1558 isc_result_t result;
1559 bool value_from_next;
1560 isc_textregion_t tr;
1561 dns_rdatatype_t rdtype;
1562 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass;
1563 char textname[MXNAME];
1564 struct in_addr in4;
1565 struct in6_addr in6;
1566 in_port_t srcport;
1567 char *hash, *cmd;
1568 uint32_t num;
1569
1570 while (strpbrk(option, single_dash_opts) == &option[0]) {
1571 /*
1572 * Since the -[46dhimnuv] options do not take an argument,
1573 * account for them (in any number and/or combination)
1574 * if they appear as the first character(s) of a q-opt.
1575 */
1576 opt = option[0];
1577 switch (opt) {
1578 case '4':
1579 if (have_ipv4) {
1580 isc_net_disableipv6();
1581 have_ipv6 = false;
1582 } else {
1583 fatal("can't find IPv4 networking");
1584 /* NOTREACHED */
1585 return (false);
1586 }
1587 break;
1588 case '6':
1589 if (have_ipv6) {
1590 isc_net_disableipv4();
1591 have_ipv4 = false;
1592 } else {
1593 fatal("can't find IPv6 networking");
1594 /* NOTREACHED */
1595 return (false);
1596 }
1597 break;
1598 case 'd':
1599 ptr = strpbrk(&option[1], dash_opts);
1600 if (ptr != &option[1]) {
1601 cmd = option;
1602 FULLCHECK("debug");
1603 debugging = true;
1604 return (false);
1605 } else
1606 debugging = true;
1607 break;
1608 case 'h':
1609 help();
1610 exit(0);
1611 break;
1612 case 'i':
1613 /* deprecated */
1614 break;
1615 case 'm': /* memdebug */
1616 /* memdebug is handled in preparse_args() */
1617 break;
1618 case 'n':
1619 /* deprecated */
1620 break;
1621 case 'r':
1622 debug("digrc (late)");
1623 digrc = false;
1624 break;
1625 case 'u':
1626 (*lookup)->use_usec = true;
1627 break;
1628 case 'v':
1629 version();
1630 exit(0);
1631 break;
1632 }
1633 if (strlen(option) > 1U)
1634 option = &option[1];
1635 else
1636 return (false);
1637 }
1638 opt = option[0];
1639 if (strlen(option) > 1U) {
1640 value_from_next = false;
1641 value = &option[1];
1642 } else {
1643 value_from_next = true;
1644 value = next;
1645 }
1646 if (value == NULL)
1647 goto invalid_option;
1648 switch (opt) {
1649 case 'b':
1650 hash = strchr(value, '#');
1651 if (hash != NULL) {
1652 result = parse_uint(&num, hash + 1, MAXPORT,
1653 "port number");
1654 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1655 fatal("Couldn't parse port number");
1656 srcport = num;
1657 *hash = '\0';
1658 } else
1659 srcport = 0;
1660 if (have_ipv6 && inet_pton(AF_INET6, value, &in6) == 1) {
1661 isc_sockaddr_fromin6(&bind_address, &in6, srcport);
1662 isc_net_disableipv4();
1663 } else if (have_ipv4 && inet_pton(AF_INET, value, &in4) == 1) {
1664 isc_sockaddr_fromin(&bind_address, &in4, srcport);
1665 isc_net_disableipv6();
1666 } else {
1667 if (hash != NULL)
1668 *hash = '#';
1669 fatal("invalid address %s", value);
1670 }
1671 if (hash != NULL)
1672 *hash = '#';
1673 specified_source = true;
1674 return (value_from_next);
1675 case 'c':
1676 if ((*lookup)->rdclassset) {
1677 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, extra class option\n");
1678 }
1679 *open_type_class = false;
1680 tr.base = value;
1681 tr.length = (unsigned int) strlen(value);
1682 result = dns_rdataclass_fromtext(&rdclass,
1683 (isc_textregion_t *)&tr);
1684 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1685 (*lookup)->rdclass = rdclass;
1686 (*lookup)->rdclassset = true;
1687 } else
1688 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, ignoring "
1689 "invalid class %s\n",
1690 value);
1691 return (value_from_next);
1692 case 'f':
1693 batchname = value;
1694 return (value_from_next);
1695 case 'k':
1696 strlcpy(keyfile, value, sizeof(keyfile));
1697 return (value_from_next);
1698 case 'p':
1699 result = parse_uint(&num, value, MAXPORT, "port number");
1700 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1701 fatal("Couldn't parse port number");
1702 port = num;
1703 return (value_from_next);
1704 case 'q':
1705 if (!config_only) {
1706 if (*need_clone)
1707 (*lookup) = clone_lookup(default_lookup,
1708 true);
1709 *need_clone = true;
1710 strlcpy((*lookup)->textname, value,
1711 sizeof((*lookup)->textname));
1712 (*lookup)->trace_root = ((*lookup)->trace ||
1713 (*lookup)->ns_search_only);
1714 (*lookup)->new_search = true;
1715 if (*firstarg) {
1716 printgreeting(argc, argv, *lookup);
1717 *firstarg = false;
1718 }
1719 ISC_LIST_APPEND(lookup_list, (*lookup), link);
1720 debug("looking up %s", (*lookup)->textname);
1721 }
1722 return (value_from_next);
1723 case 't':
1724 *open_type_class = false;
1725 if (strncasecmp(value, "ixfr=", 5) == 0) {
1726 rdtype = dns_rdatatype_ixfr;
1727 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1728 } else {
1729 tr.base = value;
1730 tr.length = (unsigned int) strlen(value);
1731 result = dns_rdatatype_fromtext(&rdtype,
1732 (isc_textregion_t *)&tr);
1733 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
1734 rdtype == dns_rdatatype_ixfr) {
1735 result = DNS_R_UNKNOWN;
1736 }
1737 }
1738 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1739 if ((*lookup)->rdtypeset) {
1740 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, "
1741 "extra type option\n");
1742 }
1743 if (rdtype == dns_rdatatype_ixfr) {
1744 uint32_t serial;
1745 (*lookup)->rdtype = dns_rdatatype_ixfr;
1746 (*lookup)->rdtypeset = true;
1747 result = parse_uint(&serial, &value[5],
1748 MAXSERIAL, "serial number");
1749 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1750 fatal("Couldn't parse serial number");
1751 (*lookup)->ixfr_serial = serial;
1752 (*lookup)->section_question = plusquest;
1753 (*lookup)->comments = pluscomm;
1754 if (!(*lookup)->tcp_mode_set)
1755 (*lookup)->tcp_mode = true;
1756 } else {
1757 (*lookup)->rdtype = rdtype;
1758 if (!config_only)
1759 (*lookup)->rdtypeset = true;
1760 if (rdtype == dns_rdatatype_axfr) {
1761 (*lookup)->section_question = plusquest;
1762 (*lookup)->comments = pluscomm;
1763 } else if (rdtype == dns_rdatatype_any) {
1764 if (!(*lookup)->tcp_mode_set)
1765 (*lookup)->tcp_mode = true;
1766 }
1767 (*lookup)->ixfr_serial = false;
1768 }
1769 } else
1770 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, ignoring "
1771 "invalid type %s\n",
1772 value);
1773 return (value_from_next);
1774 case 'y':
1775 if ((ptr = strtok_r(value, ":", &last)) == NULL) {
1776 usage();
1777 }
1778 if ((ptr2 = strtok_r(NULL, ":", &last)) == NULL) { /* name or secret */
1779 usage();
1780 }
1781 if ((ptr3 = strtok_r(NULL, ":", &last)) != NULL) { /* secret or NULL */
1782 parse_hmac(ptr);
1783 ptr = ptr2;
1784 ptr2 = ptr3;
1785 } else {
1786 hmacname = DNS_TSIG_HMACMD5_NAME;
1787 digestbits = 0;
1788 }
1789 /* XXXONDREJ: FIXME */
1790 strlcpy(keynametext, ptr, sizeof(keynametext));
1791 strlcpy(keysecret, ptr2, sizeof(keysecret));
1792 return (value_from_next);
1793 case 'x':
1794 if (*need_clone)
1795 *lookup = clone_lookup(default_lookup, true);
1796 *need_clone = true;
1797 if (get_reverse(textname, sizeof(textname), value,
1798 false) == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1799 strlcpy((*lookup)->textname, textname,
1800 sizeof((*lookup)->textname));
1801 debug("looking up %s", (*lookup)->textname);
1802 (*lookup)->trace_root = ((*lookup)->trace ||
1803 (*lookup)->ns_search_only);
1804 if (!(*lookup)->rdtypeset)
1805 (*lookup)->rdtype = dns_rdatatype_ptr;
1806 if (!(*lookup)->rdclassset)
1807 (*lookup)->rdclass = dns_rdataclass_in;
1808 (*lookup)->new_search = true;
1809 if (*firstarg) {
1810 printgreeting(argc, argv, *lookup);
1811 *firstarg = false;
1812 }
1813 ISC_LIST_APPEND(lookup_list, *lookup, link);
1814 } else {
1815 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid IP address %s\n", value);
1816 exit(1);
1817 }
1818 return (value_from_next);
1819 invalid_option:
1820 default:
1821 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid option: -%s\n", option);
1822 usage();
1823 }
1824 /* NOTREACHED */
1825 return (false);
1826}
1827
1828/*%
1829 * Because we may be trying to do memory allocation recording, we're going
1830 * to need to parse the arguments for the -m *before* we start the main
1831 * argument parsing routine.
1832 *
1833 * I'd prefer not to have to do this, but I am not quite sure how else to
1834 * fix the problem. Argument parsing in dig involves memory allocation
1835 * by its nature, so it can't be done in the main argument parser.
1836 */
1837static void
1838preparse_args(int argc, char **argv) {
1839 int rc;
1840 char **rv;
1841 char *option;
1842
1843 rc = argc;
1844 rv = argv;
1845 for (rc--, rv++; rc > 0; rc--, rv++) {
1846 if (rv[0][0] != '-')
1847 continue;
1848 option = &rv[0][1];
1849 while (strpbrk(option, single_dash_opts) == &option[0]) {
1850 switch (option[0]) {
1851 case 'd':
1852 /* For debugging early startup */
1853 debugging = true;
1854 break;
1855 case 'm':
1856 memdebugging = true;
1857 isc_mem_debugging = ISC_MEM_DEBUGTRACE |
1858 ISC_MEM_DEBUGRECORD;
1859 break;
1860 case 'r':
1861 /*
1862 * Must be done early, because ~/.digrc
1863 * is read before command line parsing
1864 */
1865 debug("digrc (early)");
1866 digrc = false;
1867 break;
1868 case '4':
1869 if (ipv6only)
1870 fatal("only one of -4 and -6 allowed");
1871 ipv4only = true;
1872 break;
1873 case '6':
1874 if (ipv4only)
1875 fatal("only one of -4 and -6 allowed");
1876 ipv6only = true;
1877 break;
1878 }
1879 option = &option[1];
1880 }
1881 if (strlen(option) == 0U) {
1882 continue;
1883 }
1884 /* Look for dash value option. */
1885 if (strpbrk(option, dash_opts) != &option[0] ||
1886 strlen(option) > 1U) {
1887 /* Error or value in option. */
1888 continue;
1889 }
1890 /* Dash value is next argument so we need to skip it. */
1891 rc--, rv++;
1892 /* Handle missing argument */
1893 if (rc == 0)
1894 break;
1895 }
1896}
1897
1898static int
1899split_batchline(char *batchline, char **bargv, int len, const char *msg) {
1900 int bargc;
1901 char *last = NULL;
1902
1903 REQUIRE(batchline != NULL);
1904
1905 for (bargc = 1, bargv[bargc] = strtok_r(batchline, " \t\r\n", &last);
1906 bargc < len && bargv[bargc];
1907 bargv[++bargc] = strtok_r(NULL, " \t\r\n", &last))
1908 {
1909 debug("%s %d: %s", msg, bargc, bargv[bargc]);
1910 }
1911 return (bargc);
1912}
1913
1914static void
1915parse_args(bool is_batchfile, bool config_only,
1916 int argc, char **argv)
1917{
1918 isc_result_t result;
1919 isc_textregion_t tr;
1920 bool firstarg = true;
1921 dig_lookup_t *lookup = NULL;
1922 dns_rdatatype_t rdtype;
1923 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass;
1924 bool open_type_class = true;
1925 char batchline[MXNAME];
1926 int bargc;
1927 char *bargv[64];
1928 int rc;
1929 char **rv;
1930#ifndef NOPOSIX
1931 char *homedir;
1932 char rcfile[PATH_MAX];
1933#endif
1934 bool need_clone = true;
1935
1936 /*
1937 * The semantics for parsing the args is a bit complex; if
1938 * we don't have a host yet, make the arg apply globally,
1939 * otherwise make it apply to the latest host. This is
1940 * a bit different than the previous versions, but should
1941 * form a consistent user interface.
1942 *
1943 * First, create a "default lookup" which won't actually be used
1944 * anywhere, except for cloning into new lookups
1945 */
1946
1947 debug("parse_args()");
1948 if (!is_batchfile) {
1949 debug("making new lookup");
1950 default_lookup = make_empty_lookup();
1951 default_lookup->adflag = true;
1952 default_lookup->edns = 0;
1953 default_lookup->sendcookie = true;
1954
1955#ifndef NOPOSIX
1956 /*
1957 * Treat ${HOME}/.digrc as a special batchfile
1958 */
1959 INSIST(batchfp == NULL);
1960 homedir = getenv("HOME");
1961 if (homedir != NULL && digrc) {
1962 unsigned int n;
1963 debug("digrc (open)");
1964 n = snprintf(rcfile, sizeof(rcfile), "%s/.digrc",
1965 homedir);
1966 if (n < sizeof(rcfile)) {
1967 batchfp = fopen(rcfile, "r");
1968 }
1969 }
1970 if (batchfp != NULL) {
1971 while (fgets(batchline, sizeof(batchline),
1972 batchfp) != 0)
1973 {
1974 debug("config line %s", batchline);
1975 bargc = split_batchline(batchline, bargv, 62,
1976 ".digrc argv");
1977 bargv[0] = argv[0];
1978 argv0 = argv[0];
1979 parse_args(true, true,
1980 bargc, (char **)bargv);
1981 }
1982 fclose(batchfp);
1983 }
1984#endif
1985 }
1986
1987 if (is_batchfile && !config_only) {
1988 /* Processing '-f batchfile'. */
1989 lookup = clone_lookup(default_lookup, true);
1990 need_clone = false;
1991 } else {
1992 lookup = default_lookup;
1993 }
1994
1995 rc = argc;
1996 rv = argv;
1997 for (rc--, rv++; rc > 0; rc--, rv++) {
1998 debug("main parsing %s", rv[0]);
1999 if (strncmp(rv[0], "%", 1) == 0)
2000 break;
2001 if (rv[0][0] == '@') {
2002
2003 if (is_batchfile && !config_only) {
2004 addresscount = getaddresses(lookup, &rv[0][1],
2005 &result);
2006 if (addresscount == 0) {
2007 fprintf(stderr, "couldn't get address "
2008 "for '%s': %s: skipping "
2009 "lookup\n", &rv[0][1],
2010 isc_result_totext(result));
2011 if (ISC_LINK_LINKED(lookup, link))
2012 ISC_LIST_DEQUEUE(lookup_list,
2013 lookup, link);
2014 destroy_lookup(lookup);
2015 return;
2016 }
2017 } else {
2018 addresscount = getaddresses(lookup, &rv[0][1],
2019 NULL);
2020 if (addresscount == 0)
2021 fatal("no valid addresses for '%s'\n",
2022 &rv[0][1]);
2023 }
2024 } else if (rv[0][0] == '+') {
2025 plus_option(&rv[0][1], is_batchfile,
2026 lookup);
2027 } else if (rv[0][0] == '-') {
2028 if (rc <= 1) {
2029 if (dash_option(&rv[0][1], NULL,
2030 &lookup, &open_type_class,
2031 &need_clone, config_only,
2032 argc, argv, &firstarg)) {
2033 rc--;
2034 rv++;
2035 }
2036 } else {
2037 if (dash_option(&rv[0][1], rv[1],
2038 &lookup, &open_type_class,
2039 &need_clone, config_only,
2040 argc, argv, &firstarg)) {
2041 rc--;
2042 rv++;
2043 }
2044 }
2045 } else {
2046 /*
2047 * Anything which isn't an option
2048 */
2049 if (open_type_class) {
2050 if (strncasecmp(rv[0], "ixfr=", 5) == 0) {
2051 rdtype = dns_rdatatype_ixfr;
2052 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2053 } else {
2054 tr.base = rv[0];
2055 tr.length =
2056 (unsigned int) strlen(rv[0]);
2057 result = dns_rdatatype_fromtext(&rdtype,
2058 (isc_textregion_t *)&tr);
2059 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
2060 rdtype == dns_rdatatype_ixfr) {
2061 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, "
2062 "ixfr requires a "
2063 "serial number\n");
2064 continue;
2065 }
2066 }
2067 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2068 if (lookup->rdtypeset) {
2069 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, "
2070 "extra type option\n");
2071 }
2072 if (rdtype == dns_rdatatype_ixfr) {
2073 uint32_t serial;
2074 lookup->rdtype =
2075 dns_rdatatype_ixfr;
2076 lookup->rdtypeset = true;
2077 result = parse_uint(&serial,
2078 &rv[0][5],
2079 MAXSERIAL,
2080 "serial number");
2081 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2082 fatal("Couldn't parse "
2083 "serial number");
2084 lookup->ixfr_serial = serial;
2085 lookup->section_question =
2086 plusquest;
2087 lookup->comments = pluscomm;
2088 if (!lookup->tcp_mode_set)
2089 lookup->tcp_mode = true;
2090 } else {
2091 lookup->rdtype = rdtype;
2092 lookup->rdtypeset = true;
2093 if (rdtype ==
2094 dns_rdatatype_axfr) {
2095 lookup->section_question =
2096 plusquest;
2097 lookup->comments = pluscomm;
2098 }
2099 if (rdtype ==
2100 dns_rdatatype_any &&
2101 !lookup->tcp_mode_set)
2102 lookup->tcp_mode = true;
2103 lookup->ixfr_serial = false;
2104 }
2105 continue;
2106 }
2107 result = dns_rdataclass_fromtext(&rdclass,
2108 (isc_textregion_t *)&tr);
2109 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2110 if (lookup->rdclassset) {
2111 fprintf(stderr, ";; Warning, "
2112 "extra class option\n");
2113 }
2114 lookup->rdclass = rdclass;
2115 lookup->rdclassset = true;
2116 continue;
2117 }
2118 }
2119
2120 if (!config_only) {
2121 if (need_clone)
2122 lookup = clone_lookup(default_lookup,
2123 true);
2124 need_clone = true;
2125 strlcpy(lookup->textname, rv[0],
2126 sizeof(lookup->textname));
2127 lookup->trace_root = (lookup->trace ||
2128 lookup->ns_search_only);
2129 lookup->new_search = true;
2130 if (firstarg) {
2131 printgreeting(argc, argv, lookup);
2132 firstarg = false;
2133 }
2134 ISC_LIST_APPEND(lookup_list, lookup, link);
2135 debug("looking up %s", lookup->textname);
2136 }
2137 /* XXX Error message */
2138 }
2139 }
2140
2141 /*
2142 * If we have a batchfile, seed the lookup list with the
2143 * first entry, then trust the callback in dighost_shutdown
2144 * to get the rest
2145 */
2146 if ((batchname != NULL) && !(is_batchfile)) {
2147 if (strcmp(batchname, "-") == 0)
2148 batchfp = stdin;
2149 else
2150 batchfp = fopen(batchname, "r");
2151 if (batchfp == NULL) {
2152 perror(batchname);
2153 if (exitcode < 8)
2154 exitcode = 8;
2155 fatal("couldn't open specified batch file");
2156 }
2157 /* XXX Remove code dup from shutdown code */
2158 next_line:
2159 if (fgets(batchline, sizeof(batchline), batchfp) != 0) {
2160 debug("batch line %s", batchline);
2161 if (batchline[0] == '\r' || batchline[0] == '\n' ||
2162 batchline[0] == '#' || batchline[0] == ';')
2163 goto next_line;
2164 bargc = split_batchline(batchline, bargv, 14,
2165 "batch argv");
2166 bargv[0] = argv[0];
2167 argv0 = argv[0];
2168 parse_args(true, false, bargc, (char **)bargv);
2169 return;
2170 }
2171 return;
2172 }
2173 /*
2174 * If no lookup specified, search for root
2175 */
2176 if ((lookup_list.head == NULL) && !config_only) {
2177 if (need_clone)
2178 lookup = clone_lookup(default_lookup, true);
2179 need_clone = true;
2180 lookup->trace_root = (lookup->trace ||
2181 lookup->ns_search_only);
2182 lookup->new_search = true;
2183 strlcpy(lookup->textname, ".", sizeof(lookup->textname));
2184 lookup->rdtype = dns_rdatatype_ns;
2185 lookup->rdtypeset = true;
2186 if (firstarg) {
2187 printgreeting(argc, argv, lookup);
2188 firstarg = false;
2189 }
2190 ISC_LIST_APPEND(lookup_list, lookup, link);
2191 }
2192 if (!need_clone)
2193 destroy_lookup(lookup);
2194}
2195
2196/*
2197 * Callback from dighost.c to allow program-specific shutdown code.
2198 * Here, we're possibly reading from a batch file, then shutting down
2199 * for real if there's nothing in the batch file to read.
2200 */
2201static void
2202query_finished(void) {
2203 char batchline[MXNAME];
2204 int bargc;
2205 char *bargv[16];
2206
2207 if (batchname == NULL) {
2208 isc_app_shutdown();
2209 return;
2210 }
2211
2212 fflush(stdout);
2213 if (feof(batchfp)) {
2214 batchname = NULL;
2215 isc_app_shutdown();
2216 if (batchfp != stdin)
2217 fclose(batchfp);
2218 return;
2219 }
2220
2221 if (fgets(batchline, sizeof(batchline), batchfp) != 0) {
2222 debug("batch line %s", batchline);
2223 bargc = split_batchline(batchline, bargv, 14, "batch argv");
2224 bargv[0] = argv0;
2225 parse_args(true, false, bargc, (char **)bargv);
2226 start_lookup();
2227 } else {
2228 batchname = NULL;
2229 if (batchfp != stdin)
2230 fclose(batchfp);
2231 isc_app_shutdown();
2232 return;
2233 }
2234}
2235
2236void dig_setup(int argc, char **argv)
2237{
2238 isc_result_t result;
2239
2240 ISC_LIST_INIT(lookup_list);
2241 ISC_LIST_INIT(server_list);
2242 ISC_LIST_INIT(search_list);
2243
2244 debug("dig_setup()");
2245
2246 /* setup dighost callbacks */
2247 dighost_printmessage = printmessage;
2248 dighost_received = received;
2249 dighost_trying = trying;
2250 dighost_shutdown = query_finished;
2251
2252 progname = argv[0];
2253 preparse_args(argc, argv);
2254
2255 result = isc_app_start();
2256 check_result(result, "isc_app_start");
2257
2258 setup_libs();
2259 setup_system(ipv4only, ipv6only);
2260}
2261
2262void dig_query_setup(bool is_batchfile, bool config_only,
2263 int argc, char **argv)
2264{
2265 debug("dig_query_setup");
2266
2267 parse_args(is_batchfile, config_only, argc, argv);
2268 if (keyfile[0] != 0)
2269 setup_file_key();
2270 else if (keysecret[0] != 0)
2271 setup_text_key();
2272 if (domainopt[0] != '\0') {
2273 set_search_domain(domainopt);
2274 usesearch = true;
2275 }
2276}
2277
2278void dig_startup() {
2279 isc_result_t result;
2280
2281 debug("dig_startup()");
2282
2283 result = isc_app_onrun(mctx, global_task, onrun_callback, NULL);
2284 check_result(result, "isc_app_onrun");
2285 isc_app_run();
2286}
2287
2288void dig_query_start()
2289{
2290 start_lookup();
2291}
2292
2293void
2294dig_shutdown() {
2295 destroy_lookup(default_lookup);
2296 if (batchname != NULL) {
2297 if (batchfp != stdin)
2298 fclose(batchfp);
2299 batchname = NULL;
2300 }
2301 cancel_all();
2302 destroy_libs();
2303 isc_app_finish();
2304}
2305
2306/*% Main processing routine for dig */
2307int
2308main(int argc, char **argv) {
2309
2310 dig_setup(argc, argv);
2311 dig_query_setup(false, false, argc, argv);
2312 dig_startup();
2313 dig_shutdown();
2314
2315 return (exitcode);
2316}
